entry.title: Organic Yaupon-1KG
entry.summary:
Vendor: Grand River Tea
Type: Yaupon
Price: 262.50

 


Yaupon is the only caffeinated plant native to North America.  This plant was used by native Americans and early settlers to North America.  It was even shipped to Europe.   

Here we are in the 21st century and it has been revived as a sustainable tea.

It's sustainably wild-harvested, hand packed and the only thing touches this plant is sunshine and rain.

This medium roast has an amazing aroma of maple a beautiful golden liquor and flavour similar to yerbe matte but sweeter.  

Packed in a  kraft bag which is biodegradable.  

Brew 1 teaspoon in 8 ounces of water for 4 -7 minutes

Re-brew up to three times

Grown: Texas, USA

entry.title: Purple Jasmine Tea-1KG
entry.summary:
Vendor: Grand River Tea
Type: Purple Tea Blend
Price: 140.00

Purple Jasmine: A cup of Purple Jasmine is fresh and delicate. The enchanting fragrance of real jasmine blossoms creates the perfect pairing of tea and flowers.

Tasting Notes: Light & Floral. Spring Jasmine & Honey

Makes 40 cups. Re-steep this whole leaf tea for 80 cups

Steeping Instructions: 1 Teaspoon –175°F – 2 mins

100% Natural Ingredients: Jasmine Green Tea, Kenyan Purple Tea, Jasmine Blossoms, Cornflower Blossoms.

Caffeine: Low

Features: Did you know that all tea comes from the jade green leaves of the tea tree, except for purple tea? This unique variety yields beautiful, vibrant purple leaves! Grown organically, these tea leaves are naturally purple because they contain anthocyanins, the same super antioxidants found in other purple plants like blueberries and pomegranates. Similar to green tea, Purple Tea is very healthy, with little caffeine and an exquisite taste. Your purchase directly employs Kenyan tea farmers.

entry.title: Kenyan Chai Black Tea-1KG
entry.summary:
Vendor: Grand River Tea
Type: Black Tea
Price: 140.00

 ‘Chai’ actually just means ‘tea’, but here in the west, we have adopted the term to mean spiced tea. Our Kenyan Chai is spiced with a unique bouquet of cloves, cinnamon, fennel and rose petals. Totally different from a spicy Indian Masala Chai, this has been known to make chai devotees rethink how they drink their chai! Also delicious as an iced tea!

Non GMO, Rain Forest Certified and Fair Trade Certified.

Tasting Notes: Sweet and Spicy 

Steeping Instructions: 1 teaspoon per 8 ounces water – 205°F – 3 mins

Natural Ingredients: Rainforest Alliance Kenyan Black tea, allspice, clove, fennel, cinnamon, licorice root, ginger, black pepper, rose petals.

Caffeine: Medium

Features: Did you know that all tea comes from the jade green leaves of the tea tree, except for purple tea? This unique variety yields beautiful, vibrant purple leaves! Grown organically, these tea leaves are naturally purple because they contain anthocyanins, the same super antioxidants found in other purple plants like blueberries and pomegranates. Similar to green tea, Purple Tea is very healthy, with little caffeine and an exquisite taste. Your purchase directly employs Kenyan tea farmers.

entry.title: Creme Earl Grey Black-1KG
entry.summary:
Vendor: Grand River Tea
Type: Black Tea
Price: 126.00


Our flavory Earl Grey mellowed with a delicious creamy taste. Enjoy anytime of day. 

Grand River Tea number one top favourite.

This tea makes delicious Earl Grey Shortbread cookies!

Earl Grey Shortbread Cookies

Ingredients 

2 cups all purpose flour

2 tablespoons Grand River Tea Earl Grey Crème tea leaves

½ teaspoon salt

¾ cup confectioners’ sugar

1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract

1 cup butter room temperature

 

Directions

In a food processor, pulse together the flour, tea and salt until the tea is just spotted throughout the flour.

Add the confectioners sugar, vanilla, and butter. Pulse together just until a dough is formed.

Place dough on a sheet of plastic wrap and roll into a log about 2 ½ inches in diameter. Tightly twist each end of wrap and chill in refrigerator for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F 

Slice the log into 1/3 inch thick disks. Place on parchment lined baking sheets 2 inches apart. 

Bake until the edges are just brown about 12 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes then transfer to wire racks and cool to room temperature. 

Enjoy!!!!!

Ingredients: Black tea, Cornflower petals, Natural flavours 

Grown: Sri Lanka

Steeping Instructions: 1 teaspoon per 8 ounces water – 205°F – 3 mins

Caffeine: Medium

entry.title: Mason Jar Matcha Green- 70G
entry.summary:
Vendor: Grand River Tea
Type: Green Tea
Price: 24.99


Tea will be packed in a zero waste 250ML mason jar.

There is perhaps no tea on today's market as celebrated or as famous as Matcha.

Once upon a time Matcha was left for the very special Japanese Tea Ceremony. 

But we've relaxed our use of matcha.  It can be served cold, added to your favourite smoothie, baked good or make yourself a latte.

Our matcha is made from the Gyokuro leaves that have been shaded under special shade covers for 3 weeks giving the leaves a rich green colour.  Once plucked, the leaves are steamed and dried then stone ground powder.

Matcha has three times the amount of antioxidants of regular green tea.

Hot Tea: Use 1/2 teaspoon per 8 ounces of hot water.  Mix vigorously to make a smooth paste-like liquid.  Enjoy as is or top with freshly steamed milk and sweeten to taste.

Ingredients: Green Tea

Grown: Japan and Kenya

Dried nettle can be consumed as a tea, in soups or try adding to your mashed potatoes.

entry.title: Flowering Green Tea Ball
entry.summary:
Vendor: Grand River Tea
Type: Green Tea
Price: 3.00

Artisan handcrafted tea ball. The infused green tea is a delight with the benefit of beautiful flowers blooming before your eyes.  Whether it's a special occasion with friends or just because. 
You'll love our unique four flowering tea balls.  Each ball has amaranth, jasmine, chrysanthemum and lavender flowers wrapped up with green tea leaves.
Luxury Ingredients: Green Tea, Amaranth, Jasmine, Chrysanthemum, Lavender Flowers

Grown: China
Place ball in your favourite glass teapot and add 194F boiled water.  Infuse until the ball is fully open around 5 minutes.  Watch the leaves and flowers unfurl.

entry.title: Roses and Chocolate Black-40G-GRT NEW BLEND
entry.summary:
Vendor: Grand River Tea
Type: Black Tea
Price: 9.00

Delicate rose petals and rich cacao from Habitual Chocolate in Woodstock, is a great compliment to our Kenyan grown black tea.  Add a bit of honey or choice of sweetener for an indulgent cup of black of tea.  Brew this one a little longer approximate 4-5 minutes to extract all the rose and chocolate aroma and flavours.

Cacao we've used in this blend is from our friends at Habitual Chocolate in Woodstock, Ontario.  They roast the cacao beans in house.

Ingredients: Kenyan Black Tea, Organic Cacao Nibs/Husks and Organic Rose Petals.

Grown: Kenya, India, Dominican Republic, (Husks-Equador, Peru, Mexico, Honduras and Columbia) 

Brew 1 heaping teaspoon in 8 ounces of water 205F for 4-5 minutes

entry.title: Grand River Detox Herbal-20G- New Grand River Tea Blend
entry.summary:
Vendor: Grand River Tea
Type: Herbal
Price: 10.00

Our unique blend of lemongrass, peppermint, stinging nettle and red clover blossoms is a delicious herbal infusion.  These four unique herbs may kick start your metabolism, natural diuretic, soothe digestion, help cleanse your body of toxins, liver cleansing and high in antioxidants.

 

Put that kettle on and enjoy our latest herbal infusion.

Grown: Canada and Kenya

Ingredients: Lemongrass, peppermint, stinging nettles and red clover blossoms

Brew: 1-2 tsp in eight ounces of boiling water 205F for 5-10 minutes.

Peppermint and lemongrass have the following certifications

Stinging Nettle and Red Clover Blossoms are harvested in Canada and are organic certified.

entry.title: Premium White Gold-20G-White Tea-Limited Quantity
entry.summary:
Vendor: Grand River Tea
Type: White
Price: 11.50

After one whole year of waiting Grand River Tea has obtained one pound of this extremely rare white tea from Kenya.  
It takes a full day to pick a half a pound of Premium White Gold.
Enjoy this tea all day long and re-steep throughout the day.  The flavour is light, florally and creamy.  Similar to silver needle white tea. Same process. Put this in your treasure tea chest and savour. 

Grown: Kenya

Ingredients:  White Tea

Steeping Instructions: 1 tsp for 3-7 minutes with 180 Deg F.  Tea leave can be re brewed up to three times

Caffeine: Low
